div.p: It is however not entirely uneatable[.]
Suny 24th[.] We had a Small Shower of rain to Day[.]

Mony 25th[.] Tuesy 26th[.] Arrived the Levrier & wife – recieved from him no more than 3½ Skins in furrs 2 in meat & 1 in Grease[.] I refused him the usual presents on arrival such as a bit Tob.o & a Dram – because I think he has been rather too lazy in not making a better Hunt[.] [H]e was extremely exasperated at this uncommon treatment and particularly at my having given him a Severe reprimand, it tickled his feelings so much that he could help exclaiming in an extacy of choler that he would not come again very soon to the Fort – which I do not care much about for he ows only 4 Skins and besides he is too fond to appear something respectable before his relations not to be as ready to make up matters as I am careless of breaking them when he does not behave wit consistant to his character of a Second rate grandee[.] Thus he left us muttering I dare say execrations against me without mercy[.] Capot Rouge sent me his Flag as a token that he would soon follow provided he could make a few Provisions to clear himself a favourable reception[.]

Wednesy 27th[.] A Great Cracking of thunder & lightening all the forenoon which was soon followed by a very heavy Shower of rain[.] A person would have persuaded himself that the whole Heavens were coming down[.]

Thursy 28th[.] Early in the morning I was alarmed by the Cries & Screeches of the Old Barbeu and wife whose child is Sick (a boy of 3 months old)[.] [H]im they have brought to me in order that I Should prescribe some speedy relief to obtain a Cure!! for which the old Gentry promise to pay me well in provns when they will have any – which I presume will not be very soon[.] I however with a design to make them think that I understood something of physic, doctor'd myself into some thing as serious as possible & then observed the part affected which I found was no more than a boil – to which I immediately applied a cleaning after having washed it with a little soap suds[.] Thinking that I had now performed enough to be dispensed with I told them to be off to their lodges & that there was no danger of the Childs life – but the old fellow had a Scabby chin
